We refer to Wikipedia articles on marketing for help. In the provided excerpt, after the speaker describes the new feature, the video cuts to a YouTube Studio analytics screen that displays the feature in action, which helps establish that the new YouTube Analytics “video overview” feature is being demonstrated.

Therefore, the answer is (A).

The reason given for focusing on AVD instead of average percentage viewed is that percentage viewed is easier to score high on short videos, so comparing across lengths can be unfair. This means that shorter videos might have a higher percentage viewed despite lower overall watch time, which can distort comparisons. Therefore, it's better to use average view duration (AVD) as a more reliable metric for measuring engagement and success.
